titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Tomlinson Bousfield patent 1978_130
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:41:44 +0000.

did.unittitle: George Tomlinson Bousfield patent (collection to be reassessed)
did.abstract: Patent issued to George Tomlinson Bousfield of Loughborough Park in the County of Surrey, Great Britain for an invention for improving the manufacture of fuel from peat and other vegetable matter. The patent indicates that Bousfield had had the invention communicated to him by Louis Elsford of the City of New York in the United States of America. The patent contains an official wax seal and dates from 1866.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); George Tomlinson Bousfield patent, 1978_130, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
